title: CPI(ML) Liberation MP writes to Speaker Birla, seeks special sitting to discuss US tariff threats
desc: CPI(ML) Liberation MP Raja Ram Singh has urged Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla to convene a special session to discuss the impact of the Trump administration's tariff threats on Indian agriculture. Singh emphasized that higher tariffs on Indian exports could devastate Indian farmers and the agricultural sector.

title: "Will personally take farmers to meeting with Center on May 4": Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann
desc: Punjab Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann supports the farmers' movement and plans to take them for talks with the Center on May 4. He emphasizes that the protest is aimed at the central government and highlights Punjab's challenges, including combating drugs without harsh measures.

title: Jagjit Singh Dallewal has not ended indefinite fast, says farmer leader
desc: Punjab farmer leader Jagjit Singh Dallewal has not ended his indefinite hunger strike despite accepting water after detained farmers were released, said his close aide Abhimanyu Kohar. The Punjab government claimed Dallewal broke his fast, but close aides clarify he remains on strike until their demands for legal MSP guarantees are met. Farmers were detained and then released following protests at Khanauri and Shambhu borders.

title: Govt committed to Bihar's all-round development: PM Modi
desc: Prime Minister Modi reaffirmed his government's commitment to the overall development of Bihar with the approval of the Kosi Mechi Intra-State Link Project. This initiative aims to enhance irrigation and boost farmers' income. Additionally, the Patna-Arrah-Sasaram corridor and Electronics Component Manufacturing Scheme are set to drive economic growth and innovation while job creation is also expected to rise.

title: Cabinet approves Rs 37,216 cr subsidy on phosphatic, potassic fertilisers
desc: The Union Cabinet approved a Rs 37,216 crore subsidy on phosphatic and potassic fertilisers for the Kharif season 2025. This will ensure that farmers receive soil nutrients at affordable prices. The subsidy is aimed at maintaining current retail prices of fertilisers like DAP. This move supports nutrient availability based on international price trends.

title: Cabinet approves Rs 37,216 cr subsidy on phosphatic, potassic fertilisers
desc: The Union Cabinet approved a ₹37,216 crore subsidy on phosphatic and potassic (P&K) fertilisers for Kharif 2025 to ensure farmers receive soil nutrients at reasonable rates. The subsidy includes increased rates for phosphorus and sulphur, in response to international price trends, and aims to maintain stable retail prices.

title: Closely evaluating impact of US duties on steel, aluminium: Govt
desc: The US has imposed additional import duties on steel and aluminium imports from all countries, including India. The Indian government is evaluating the impact of these duties and continues to engage with the US to enhance and broaden bilateral trade ties. Measures to protect Indian farmers and leverage FTAs for economic growth were also highlighted.

title: Farmers Protest: SC calls for status reports from Punjab, Haryana govts; says not detached from realities
desc: The Supreme Court acknowledges it is aware of the ground realities of the farmers' protest. It requests detailed reports from Punjab and Haryana and notes positive progress, praising Jagjit Singh Dallewal for his leadership. Key highways and roads have been reopened, indicating a potential resolution.

title: Farmer leader Sarwan Singh Pandher released from jail; to hold press conference
desc: Farmer leader Sarwan Singh Pandher was released from Muktsar Sahib prison and condemned the AAP-led Punjab government for suppressing farmers' protests. Pandher, along with other detained leaders, plans to discuss further actions. Tensions rose as the Punjab administration allegedly used excessive force against protestors, leading to more farmers being released from custody recently.

title: Deceiving farmers is for nobody's good: FM Nirmala Sitharaman in Rajya Sabha
desc: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman criticized the Congress for allegedly deceiving farmers with their loan waiver promises that were not fully implemented and left many farmers ineligible for new loans. She contrasted this with Prime Minister Modi's transparent Direct Benefit Transfer scheme, which provides direct financial aid to small farmers.

title: KTR slams Telangana govt for 'hosting beauty pageants' amid farmers' suicides
desc: BRS's K T Rama Rao criticizes the Telangana government for spending Rs 55 crore on beauty pageants amid a farmer suicide crisis. He questions the relevance of such events and highlights the cancellation of the Rs 46 crore Formula-E event, which he claims deterred significant investments.

title: Is Trump’s $1 billion food aid cut pushing more low-income Americans into hunger? Here's how food banks, farmers, and families are struggling
desc: Trump’s funding cuts to The Emergency Food Assistance Program (TEFAP) and the Local Food Purchase Assistance (LFPA) program are leaving food banks across the U.S. struggling to meet increasing demand. These cuts, totaling $1 billion, reduce food supplies to pantries, risking hunger for millions of low-income families. Hunger rates surged to 13.5% in 2023, the highest in a decade. Without immediate action, food insecurity will worsen in rural and urban communities.

title: Farmers should use tech to enhance soil quality, boost agricultural productivity: Union Minister Bhagirath Choudhary
desc: Bhagirath Choudhary, Union Minister of State for Agriculture and Farmers Welfare, focused on the crucial role of soil testing in helping farmers understand the unique requirements of their land.

title: Agritech startup Grow Indigo raises $10 million from British International Investment
desc: The funds will be used for expanding sustainability programmes across India, accelerating farmer enrolment and scaling carbon farming initiatives. The company last raised $8 million from Indigo Ag and Mahyco.

title: India top milk producer in the world: Animal Husbandry Minister
desc: India, as the world's top milk producer, targets increasing milk production to 300 MMT in the next five years under the Rashtriya Gokul Mission. Since the launch of the mission in 2014, milk production has surged by 63.5%, with significant involvement of women in the sector.

title: Araku Coffee launched in canteens of both houses of Parliament
desc: Araku Coffee, a unique terroir-mapped coffee from Andhra Pradesh, was launched in the Parliament canteens, praised by Union Ministers and PM Modi for its organic growth and distinctive taste. With 1.5 lakh tribal farmers involved, it has gained global recognition and is being promoted to further boost its premium status and support local farmers.

title: Removal of 20pc export duty on onion to boost farmers' income: Agriculture Minister
desc: The government's decision to remove the 20 per cent customs duty on onion exports starting April 1 aims to enhance farmers' income by allowing them better access to global markets. Agriculture Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan stated that this step is part of the Narendra Modi government's commitment to ensuring remunerative prices for farmers and protecting them from falling onion prices.

title: Agriculture Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan urges quick transfer of farm tech from labs to fields
desc: Agriculture Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan emphasized the swift transfer of farm technologies from labs to fields, highlighting the importance of smart farming and advanced digital technologies. At the Indian Agricultural Research Institute's convocation, he underscored the need for sustainable agriculture, climate-resilient farming, and boosting income for small farmers through research, innovation, and startups.

title: India's farm insurance proves costly for most vulnerable
desc: Indian farmers facing climate-vulnerable conditions are hindered by high premiums and lower payouts in the national crop insurance scheme. Despite advancements in technology to improve transparency, farmers like Dileep Patidar struggle with inadequate coverage and prolonged delays in claim settlements.

title: Congress MPs condemn farmer leaders' detention, see AAP, BJP collusion
desc: A group of Congress MPs from Punjab protested outside Parliament against the detention of farmer leaders and the clearing of protest sites by the Punjab police. They accused the Centre, AAP-led Punjab government, and BJP-led Haryana government of collaborating against farmers. Congress leaders, including Rahul Gandhi, condemned the actions as undemocratic and anti-farmer.

title: PM-Kisan: Govt recovers Rs 416 crore from ineligible farmers, check if you need to return the money
desc: The PM-Kisan scheme, launched in 2019, ensures financial aid for eligible farmers through direct cash transfers. The government has recovered Rs 416 crore from ineligible beneficiaries, emphasizing strict measures for verifying eligibility and transparency, including Aadhaar linking, land ownership checks, and eKYC verification.

title: Rahul Gandhi meets Punjab Congress MPs protesting over farmers' issue
desc: Congress MP Rahul Gandhi met with protesting Punjab Congress MPs, including Amarinder Singh Raja Warring, over the eviction of farmers at Punjab-Haryana borders. Warring condemned the actions against farmers, blaming Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann and Union Home Minister Amit Shah. Samajwadi Party's Akhilesh Yadav criticized the BJP-led government, calling for discussions on farmers' demands. Protests ensued in Haryana and Punjab.

title: Farmers' protest: Security heightened at Haryana-Punjab Shambhu border
desc: Heightened security marks the Haryana-Punjab Shambhu Border as Haryana Police dismantles barriers to allow farmer movement. Patiala SSP assures the road will be cleared without using force. Several farmer leaders face detainment, prompting mixed reactions from politicians and farmer organizations. Former Punjab CM Channi and BJP leader Bajwa criticize government's actions amid ongoing talks.

title: Bill Gates tries his hand at pesticide sprayer made by startup to ease farmers' woes
desc: Microsoft co-founder Bill Gates tested a new pesticide sprayer at the Indian Agricultural Research Institute in New Delhi. Developed by engineer Yogesh Gawande, the innovative device helps farmers spray chemicals over multiple crop rows efficiently. Successful in India and gaining traction in Africa, the sprayer reduces the burden of carrying heavy tanks and adjusts for different plant heights.

title: All countrymen should stand with farmers: Bajrang Punia on ongoing protest at Shambhu border
desc: Olympic wrestler Bajrang Punia criticizes the government for arresting protesting farmers at Shambhu Border, labeling it a betrayal. He accuses the government of pretending to engage in dialogue while trying to suppress the farmers' movement. Punia urges citizens to support farmers against what he sees as oppressive actions by both the Central and Punjab governments.

title: Farmer leaders detained as Punjab clears protest sites
desc: Several farmer leaders in Punjab were detained by police while heading to protest sites following inconclusive talks with Union ministers regarding a minimum support price (MSP) guarantee law for crops. The detentions, aiming to clear blockade sites, sparked strong reactions from opposition leaders who accused the state and Union governments of being complicit.

title: Police detain Jagjit Singh Dallewal, others as they remove protesting farmers from Shambhu Border
desc: Punjab Police removed farmers from the Shambhu and Khanauri borders who were protesting against the central government’s policies. Key farmer leaders were detained, leading to backlash from various political figures. Punjab Minister Harpal Singh Cheema stressed that protests should be directed at the central government in Delhi.

title: Par panel asks govt to examine mechanism of determining milk prices by procurement agencies
desc: A parliamentary panel urges the government to review milk price determination to ensure farmers get better returns. It highlights that milk price inflation is lower than food inflation, affecting farmer income. The panel also calls for addressing milk adulteration and explains the suspension of the Delhi Milk Scheme license by FSSAI.

title: Onion and soyabean farmers demand measures to boost exports
desc: As onion and soyabean prices decline in India, industry and farmer groups urge the government for support measures such as reducing onion export duty and providing incentives for exporting soybean meal. Despite earlier import duty hikes on cooking oils, soyabean prices remain below the minimum support levels, impacting farmers' profitability. Onion exports also witnessed a 52% drop this year.
